text: Yamanashi Broadcasting System Headquarters, Kofu, Yamanashi designed by Kenzō Tange , also known as YBS, is a Japanese broadcast network affiliated with Nippon News Network (NNN). Its headquarters is located in Kōfu, Yamanashi. == Network == * TV: Nippon News Network (NNN) * RADIO: Japan Radio Network (JRN), National Radio Network (NRN) ==Stations== === Digital TV(ID:4) === *Kōfu JOJF- DTV 25ch ===Radio=== *Kōfu JOJF 765 kHz; 90.9 MHz FM ==Programs== ===Radio=== * YBS Radio news(YBSラジオニュース) * YBS News up(YBSニュースアップ) * YBS News halftime(YBSニュースハーフタイム) * 765morning * 765Music Express(765MUX) * FUN TAME(ふぁん★タメ) * Shoko Sawada's Saturday Jamboree(沢田聖子のサタデージャンボリー) * RADIUS(ラヂウス) * Yukko's POPSAT(ゆっこのポプサタ) * DIG THE MUSIC * FREE STYLE * Hanchingu(はんちんぐ) ===TV=== * YBS News(YBSニュース) * YBS Wide News(YBSワイドニュース) * YBS Midnight News(YBSニュース深夜便) * Tomo-chan chi no goji(ともちゃん家の5時) * VENT Spo!(VENTスポ!) * Kurayami de aimasho(暗闇で逢いましょう) * Yamanashi genki navi(やまなし元気ナビ) == Rival Stations == ===Radio=== * FM Fuji(エフエム富士) - independent, formerly of JFN ===TV=== * UHF Television Yamanashi(UTY,テレビ山梨) - JNN ==LINK== *Yamanashi Broadcasting System Category:Television stations in Japan Category:Radio in Japan Category:Nippon News Network Category:Companies based in Yamanashi Prefecture Category:Mass media in Kōfu, Yamanashi Category:Radio stations established in 1954 Category:Television channels and stations established in 1959
title: Yamanashi Broadcasting System
